IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE EDUCATION FOR GIRLS IN GRADES 9 THROUGH 12.
IRS990.MissionDesc: EMMA WILLARD SCHOOL IS A PRIVATELY OPERATED SCHOOL FOR GIRLS IN GRADES 9 THROUGH 12 FOR BOARDING AND DAY STUDENTS.
IRS990.Desc: SECONDARY EDUCATION: PRIVATE HIGH SCHOOL FOR GIRLS (APPROXIMATELY 359 STUDENTS)

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SUMMER SCHOOL PROGRAMS: SUMMER EDUCATION PROGRAMS FOR APPROXIMATELY 400 STUDENTS.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN - ANTIGUA & BARBUDA, ARUBA, BAHAMAS,

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL INVESTS IN SEVEN LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS ORGANIZED IN THE CAYMAN ISLANDS.
REDUCTION IN TUITION APPLIED DIRECTLY TO TUITION ACCOUNTS
HOUSEKEEPING SERVICES ARE PROVIDED AS A PERSONAL SERVICE IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE HOUSING PROVIDED BY THE SCHOOL.
THE HEAD OF SCHOOL PARTICIPATES IN A 457-F PLAN.
WHEN DONATED SECURITIES ARE SOLD, A THIRD PARTY IS USED TO PROCESS AND SELL THESE SECURITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM AND REVIEWED BY INTERNAL MANAGEMENT. THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE AND AUDIT REVIEWS THE FORM 990. A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS THEN PROVIDED TO THE GOVERNING BODY PRIOR TO SUBMISSION TO THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES RECEIVES A CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE TO COMPLETE AT EACH OCTOBER BOARD MEETING. THE COMPLETED QUESTIONNAIRES ARE COLLECTED AND REVIEWED BY THE CFO. IF THERE IS AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT IT IS DISCLOSED TO THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES SO THAT SAFEGUARDS CAN BE ESTABLISHED TO PROTECT ALL PARTIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHAIR, TREASURER, SECRETARY AND ANY CHAIR-ELECT AND VICE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES SHALL TOGETHER CONSTITUTE A COMMITTEE ON COMPENSATION THAT SHALL (1) ESTABLISH AND REVIEW ANNUALLY GUIDELINES FOR AND COMPENSATION OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL (CEO) AND ALL SENIOR ADMINISTRATORS REPORTING TO THE HEAD AND ANY EXECUTIVES WHOSE SALARIES ARE REPORTED ON THE SCHOOL'S FORM 990; (2) REVIEW AND APPROVE CASH AND NO-CASH COMPENSATION PACKAGES FOR NEW AND EXISTING EMPLOYEES WHO FALL WITHIN SUBPART (1) HEREOF, INCLUDING REVIEW AND APPROVAL OF UNBUDGETED SALARY ACTIONS AND/OR PROMOTIONS; AND (3) ADVISE THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IN THE HIRING OF THE HEAD AND THE HEAD'S COMPENSATION PACKAGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
